website_summaries.verdict: Take your workout to another level with this home system.
pros: Easily fits into a basement or can look good in any room with its sleek design
We also love the safe locking grips that provide added security when using heavy weight
cons: While most of the structure is steel, we could do without the small plastic covers

customer_reviews.title: Good luck building it with missing pieces .
customer_reviews.text: The equipment seems great. However I ordered it 3 weeks ago and can’t build it due to the fact the first shipment was missing pieces . I called, and the second shipment was nothing of what I needed. So now I have duplicate parts and a garage of scrap. Would love for something to be done.
customer_reviews.author: Austin B.

customer_reviews.title: They get the job done...
customer_reviews.text: Pros - Heavy duty, they feel very sturdy, more than adequate rating (per arm) and the length too is more than enough... shouldn't have any trouble with bench pressing or shoulder pressing to failure...or using them to rest a barbell for shrugs or doing power rack deadlifts. Cons - Upside down safety bars would be a better choice...BUT Titan Fitness doesn't make them for the T2 Power Cage. Only for the X2 one when it comes to a similar style (price point) power cage of theirs).
customer_reviews.author: A. Mindev

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly, yet satisfying
customer_reviews.text: This sturdy little rack does what it’s intended to do. Fit where it was needed and is nice and sturdy. However, many of the steel pieces were not level or not quite the right length lending itself to quite a wobble-an easy fix by shoving some cardboard under one corner. As for ease of assembly, after some internet searching I found a PDF as no manual was included. The hex bolts used to tighten the rack are tedious as you must hold one side while tightening the other. So. 3/5. Good for the next while until I move and have more space for bigger and better.
customer_reviews.author: Collin M Smith

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy workmanship and bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set about year and half ago but assembled it only this week. I found that Jhooks had manufacturing defect. So I contacted the customer service with pictures. I understand it was past warranty period but the fact remains that I had just opened the box and found a defective item shipped to me. It had not been put to any use and was in brand new condition. The supplier refused point blank to consider any replacement of defective items. He hid behind the legalese. I guess we get what we pay for. I just want to caution other buyers to avoid this bad quality product with a customer service which is little better.
customer_reviews.author: Master Yoda

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: Cage had a second more glossy paint on it in random spots and rust on the pullup bar. One of the Jhooks was broken. Reached out to titan distributors and they said send it back if your not happy. Was already put together and didnt want to take apart and send back. Really just wanted them to send out a new rust free pullup bar and new Jhooks. They wernt responsive after the just send it back then remark. Wont be purchasing or recommending titan fitness again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfect size
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a full sized rack and now I wonder why. It just took up more room. I ordered a second pair of horizontal safety bars and received them quickly. I also sound deadened the rack with Dynamat inserted inside of tubes as I assembled it. Who says you can't do powerlifting on the 3rd floor of an apartment. I also used the rubber coated weights and the 6' non rattle curl bar for extra stealth.
customer_reviews.author: David S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Okay, this is 5 stars assuming it’s correct for you. I’m surprised that some people don’t read the description then give it a low rating because it’s short. It’s perfect for me. I’m 5’7”, 160 lbs, I doubt I’ll ever rack 400 lb, and I don’t use the pull-up bar. It ships fast, goes together in 20 minutes, and it’s more than sturdy enough, all of the tubing is 11 gauge. Anything more would be a waste of money. If you’re 6’ tall you’ll hit your head when you unrack a squat. If you’re the 1% who squat 1000 lb don’t buy it. For its intended purpose it’s the best value you’ll find.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Good value!
customer_reviews.text: These spotter arms are a perfect fit for my old 2" square Bodysmith (Parabody) power rack. Very secure attachment and I love the UHMW liners that will help protect the knurling on my bars. I plan to use these for inside rack pulls, etc. as well as outside the rack bench presses. Not quite the fit and finish of the Rogue offerings but at 1/2 the price they suit my needs and represent a great value! A Titan X-3 power rack is now on my wish list!
customer_reviews.author: Gromulus

customer_reviews.title: Very short, check measurements
customer_reviews.text: Well built, solid rack. It is a lot shorter than the t-3 short rack. I assumed that it was the same height when ordering, but that is my fault. I threw a couple 4x6's under the frame and it's fine now. It had a little dirt in the boxes when I opened them and the boxes arrived 3 days apart from each other. No major complaints, it is a very good rack for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Good so far!
customer_reviews.text: I have to get used to using these for chest and shoulder presses, but when I'm using them to place the dumbbells on them for other exercises instead of on the ground, they're great. However, I do not recommend these if you have the locking nut old school dumbbells because there's not much of a landing for mounting after reps. Also, the plastic on the landing pads are going to take a beating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I do like it. However I was sent parts with gouges ...
customer_reviews.text: I do like it. However I was sent parts with gouges and rust and the replacements were worse. So I used what came first & got to have some fun with a DIY project (sanders, primers, rust prevention). I use resistance bands (chest fly's/cross-overs) on this w/o a plate loaded back. Use the DB attachments (sold separately) which are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: It’s sturdy & really good
customer_reviews.text: It’s sturdy & really good. It’s just pretty small. That’s my fault for not reading the measurements. I’m 5’4 and the pull up bar is really low. My husband ended up raising the whole platform with thick wood and screwing the rack into the wood so it’s taller for me to actually be able to do pull ups.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Verostick

customer_reviews.title: This company was wonderful about returning it without any questions
customer_reviews.text: We made the mistake of buying this not realizing this was a SHORT power rack ... no one else's fault but our own, unfortunately. This company was wonderful about returning it without any questions. Giving this 5 stars because it was made nicely and would have been great if it was just a little taller.
customer_reviews.author: Beth L.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it. Especially if your over 5’8” and lift heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend this product to anyone. If you are over 5’8” your head is going to hit the top of the rack. The rack is somewhat stable and can be used for females that are short who lift light weights. The people that shipped me the product took a very long time to ship as they sent the package with missing parts TWO TIMES. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Don’t hesitate, you will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly on Valor fitness BD-33. I was hesitant at first to purchase because it was wasn’t the same brand, however, once I finally purchased, I wish I would of bought it sooner. Came well packaged even though it didn’t need to be because these things are solid! They are Heavy duty and can take any amount of weight you can throw at it. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: I assembled it which was difficult considering it didn't come with instructions and the code provided to get the instructions online didn't work. Then once assembled I realize the j-hooks are missing. I email them to see if I can get them shipped to me and Titan responds they can't do replacements and I have to return the whole item back and get a replacement...it's ridiculous that I have to return what is already assembled just because they didn't include j-hooks...how hard can it be to provide them?! So disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Stefani

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this rack
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this rack. Firstly, it is accurately described here. It arrived much earlier than anticipated. It arrived complete. Assembly was very easy with a socket wrench. The material is quality, coated and well finished. It does not squeak and is very steady. It is a short rack which is perfect for squatting and bench press. I LOVE the dip bars. VERY worth the extra 15 bucks. Make sure you evaluate the dimensions on this rack for the space you have for it. For me, it's perfect. 5 star rating well earned. Bravo, Titan.
customer_reviews.author: M. Self

customer_reviews.title: One year after purchase
customer_reviews.text: I brought this for the sole purpose of being able to workout in my garage. It is very convenient for its small size although if you’re taller than 5’7 or so your legs will hit the floor if your doing pull ups. I’ve been using it on and off for a year and it’s sturdiness is primo. I took off one star since the bar’s rough grip rubs off the paint on the j hooks. Overall it took me one hour to assemble everything together with a friend. Simply screw in the right parts with the right screws.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Long enough to be useful
customer_reviews.text: I use this attachment on my valor BD-7 power rack. It works perfectly. The bottom hole (where the safety pin goes in) doesn't line up, but in my opinion that doesn't matter at all. These are solid and I've already dropped over 300 pounds on them. They are well built and most importantly, long enough to be useful.
customer_reviews.author: Creighton L.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I have searched for years for a dumbbell holder that was steady and secure. The Titan is just that. It is simple, strong and easy to use. It fits my Parabody 2" x 2" power rack perfectly. If you are looking for an alternative to grabbing two heavy dumbbells off the floor and trying to balance them while you position yourself on your bench, here is your answer.
customer_reviews.author: GLC

customer_reviews.title: I’m glad there are other options that work w my tack
customer_reviews.text: I like that it works on my Rogue rack although it was made for a larger Titan rack. More thought is needed for the shipping. The item protruded out of the box and is missing one of the end caps.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Mar

customer_reviews.title: Defective Vertical Column
customer_reviews.text: The product itself was easy to assemble. However, after setting up the cage, realize that one of the vertical columns was defective, where the holes between the front and back of the column are misaligned by 1-2 millimeter. Therefore, unable to use the safety bar on one side as the rod doesn't slide all the way through. Also the J hook scratches the surface every time it's on that defective column. Calling the customer service line, but no response.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Just waiting...
customer_reviews.text: Only have received one box of parts for the rack so far. It has the safeties, j hooks, pull up bar, and the top three braces (along with a fourth?). Will update my review when or if I get the rest of the parts, because so far I don't even have nuts and bolts to assemble the pieces I do have.
customer_reviews.author: Jasso_Janson

customer_reviews.title: Stable Unit
customer_reviews.text: This provides the features it is meant to for weight lifting and pull ups. We needed a shorter version to fit with a low basement overhead and this fits the bill.
customer_reviews.author: LaBelle  Coeur

customer_reviews.title: Perfect height for low ceilings
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my boyfriend for his birthday. He only had one place he could put it and that place has a low ceiling. The short rack fits perfectly. It works great for someone at his height - 5'10. Probably wouldn't be great for someone over 6 feet though. It is extremely stable and sturdy. A great purchase for those who like work out at home.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn K.

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly in my small space. Expect what you spent.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, assembly was easy, did it alone. That being said, I would have saved some time if I knew there weren’t instructions with it. Mine came in two boxes half a week apart, and I didn’t know that happening. Communication was lacking on both fronts. That being said, “You get what you pay for.”
customer_reviews.author: Robert McCrae

customer_reviews.title: Watch a YouTube video for install
customer_reviews.text: Works great for me. Instructions would have been good. The RFID code didn't work so we watched a video. Pretty simple to put together though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good.
customer_reviews.text: I use them on a new york barbell (TDS) rack and they work beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: jason gates

customer_reviews.title: Overall a very solid piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.text: Overall a very solid piece of equipment. However, one the provided J-Hooks was bent beyond use when I unpacked the rack. I have contacted Titan and I am awaiting their response. I will update this review after I can actually use it. Edit: Titan Fitness was very responsive and helpful in replacing the bent J-Hook, and even sent a much nicer replacement set from what the rack came with. I am 6'0" and I can barely do squat inside the rack, so be warned if you are around 6'0" or higher. Otherwise, a solid, wonderful piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hen

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time and assembled easily. The instruction sheets are a bit unclear and can be improved. I bought the 71.5 inch rack and it turns out the pull up bar is only around 70 inches high. It would be better if it was connected right at the top. The J shaped saftey bars are solid and well able to retain any weight. The self locking design is good.
customer_reviews.author: rk

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good!!!! Just put it together and it is nice... I would not go crazy with it weight wise though you DO get what u pay for... I would look in to the T-3 if your in the 300lb plus area. Then again if you could lift that much I wouldn't tell you what to do
customer_reviews.author: Jeff vedovelli

customer_reviews.title: Quality Material
customer_reviews.text: Actual product is quite durable and made out of great material. The instructions are fairly easy to follow and can be assembled 1 person (although 2 is recommended). This product takes a while to ship and comes in two fairly heavy boxes, so plan accordingly. Overall good product.
customer_reviews.author: Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: These holders work very well but you need to get used to them. A regular dumbbell needs a 1 lb weight or so put on first then the actual lifting weights to fit good on the holder. Fits well on the 2x2 and 1 inch hole power cages.
customer_reviews.author: MSL

customer_reviews.title: Know what attachments you want before you buy any model (t2/t3), they are not interchangeable!
customer_reviews.text: I don't like that they purposely made the attachments specific to the t2/t3 models. It seems counterintuitive to me, why not make it universal so you sell more products so I can get a matching set. Instead I have to go to the competition for parts.
customer_reviews.author: John Mandich

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2x2 rack great and holds up to pretty heavy dumbbells
customer_reviews.text: Fit my 2x2 rack and hold my powerblock dumbbells great.
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for heavy DB use
customer_reviews.text: Titan was the only place I could find that carries these. Excellent for heavy DB use.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: A MUST have if you workout solo and use heavy dumbbells.
customer_reviews.author: Ellis michael Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Not level!
customer_reviews.text: There were no directions for the squat rack and it’s wobbly. One side floats off the floor no matter how many times we loosened and tightened. We used a leveler to make sure it wasn’t the floor and the floor is level. For the price it should not have issues! Beyond upset.
customer_reviews.author: Dione Mccarthy

customer_reviews.title: like the grips you find on a regular bench press ...
customer_reviews.text: only thing I wish was different: I wish the pull up bar was more grippy.. like the grips you find on a regular bench press bar. other than that I love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: seeker407

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent rack. The assembly is straightforward and takes about an hour. Did it solo with no problems. I would recommend getting workout tiles if you're going to put it on a concrete slab directly. Also, take note of the size. I'm 5'9" and this is perfect for me, but if I was any taller it would be difficult to get in and out.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: You pay in time for what you get
customer_reviews.text: Recieved three packages with missing parts. Feels cheap in quality. Dissatisfied
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hook was welded crooked
customer_reviews.text: Just got rack today was easy to assemble and is light. I'm 6" so this rack is short for me but grys the job done had to get it because can't fit full size in basement. The one hook is welded crooked and can't fit into the rack so it's useless until they send me a new one or I have to buy one myself.
customer_reviews.author: Tom lange

customer_reviews.title: is a bit too short,
customer_reviews.text: is a bit too short, i bump my head when i stand to lift the bar off the rack for squats
customer_reviews.author: actionsauce6

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and very sturdy. It was actually taller than I thought it would be and is perfect for pull ups (we are both 5'5")
customer_reviews.author: NowAMrs

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: The package didnt actually come with any installation instructions but were easy enough to find online. All the parts fit together with no issues, very pleased with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: SAFEST POSSIBLE DUMBELL SET UP
customer_reviews.text: This could fit most power cages and racks with 2x2 square tubes with one inch holes. This allows for easy transition for exercises without the risk of a knee boost going poorly.
customer_reviews.author: mattattack731

customer_reviews.title: Not the best for tall people
customer_reviews.text: I am 6 feet tall and it is much too short for me but all in all it’s a nice rack just had to make some modifications
customer_reviews.author: Scott C.

customer_reviews.title: Took two people to build and it wasn't that difficult ...
customer_reviews.text: Took two people to build and it wasn't that difficult. You need tools though. Works well in our basement where the ceiling is low. Wish they had spotter arms.
customer_reviews.author: L. Reyes

customer_reviews.title: HappyMedium!
customer_reviews.text: Equipment is great! costumer service not so much I couldn’t find the link to the manual and I try calling the number on the website no one answers. So I think I got it right, without using the the manual, by the way Thanks for the extra screws I’m gonna pump those 300lb now!
customer_reviews.author: Coach

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Good product, with fast delivery! It's sturdy, we haven't put too much weight on it so far but working up to it. Don't expect to be able to do pull ups on it though it's too short for that. If you are tall, it's probably not for you.
customer_reviews.author: V. Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Cage
customer_reviews.text: Had issue with shipping damage company handled it like a champ. Equipment works and holds up nicely
customer_reviews.author: Justin  Rausch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent rack for the money
customer_reviews.text: Excellent rack for the money. The dipping bars aren't machined but welded together by hand as they're not exactly the same, however even in spite of that, your dips will be fine. They shipped two upright boxes to me by accident but customer service from them is outstanding. 5 stars for both quality product and taking care of the buyers.
customer_reviews.author: Sho Shuto

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate product
customer_reviews.text: Inaccurate product was sent- a HD pull up bar not weight bar holders.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied, AGAIN!!’
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected. I thought it would take a week to arrive, but it was at my door on the third business day!!!!
customer_reviews.author: WHJE**

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and perfect for low ceilings
customer_reviews.text: It is perfect for a low ceiling room. As stated in earlier reviews the uprights height would be enough if you are at 5' 8" or below. This rack is well built and very sturdy when put together. The instructions are lacking a bit, but you have only 2 kinds of bolts, the round headed ones hold the four corners to the bottom sides. Took about a couple of hours to put together singlehandedly. Well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: AayKay

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my power rack
customer_reviews.text: Was very happy to find these dumbell holders and they work great with my power rack. So far I've used with up to 60 lb dumbells but can handle much heavier.
customer_reviews.author: John H Galey

customer_reviews.title: Great unit. Fits in my basement well
customer_reviews.text: Great unit. Fits in my basement well. I was nervous about the shipping but the boxes were in good condition when i received them. Incredibly easy to put together, sturdy. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: D and J

customer_reviews.title: We love this! It is a bit wobbly because we ...
customer_reviews.text: We love this! It is a bit wobbly because we haven't put any weight on the back upright bars, but it still works great for pullups, and is just awesome to have.
customer_reviews.author: M. M. Poor

customer_reviews.title: Fairly easy to put together with two ppl
customer_reviews.text: Quick to arrive. Fairly easy to put together with two ppl. Dry heavy duty and fits perfect in my small basement with lowered ceiling. Super happy with this!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: No instruction manual included just a paper with link to their website. Website doesn’t bring you to anything other then the company’s products so I put it together by picture. Quality could have been better but serves its purpose
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Great for limited space!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing short squat rack, highly recommend it for anyone wanting a squat rack with limited space. If you are over 5'8 you might not want this rack, for it may be too small for the larger bros/brosettes. I'm 5'6 by the way.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Mee

customer_reviews.title: Eliminate slamming
customer_reviews.text: No doubt, very useful when pressing heavy weights and don’t want to slam the weights on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: I have zero regrets about buying this. Best bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Sievers

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The product was easy to put together. It came in with somw scratches on the some of the metal pieces. Overall love this item.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love with this. It's perfect. Solid good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: J Bee

customer_reviews.title: easy to assemble even with one person
customer_reviews.text: Quality rack, easy to assemble even with one person, the fastening bolts are metric so be prepared for that when you begin assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Cote

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy construction and looks like it will last for years
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what I need it to. Sturdy construction and looks like it will last for years. Only reason it's not a 5 star review is that mine came without any assembly instructions. Luckily you don't have to be a bald eagle brain surgeon to figure out how it goes together.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with the quality of this cage
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the quality of this cage! It isn't that cheap thin steel that you risk getting when ordering weight equipment online. Even the safety bars are solid 1" stock. Also, I am 5'10" and have no trouble using this for squats. I was concerned that the upper support would get in the way since this is the short cage. The only downside is that my specific adjustable bench can't slide in far enough for inclines because of the back floor support. But that was expected and it's easy enough to just use the front uprights instead.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good equipment, but go with the taller version. Especially if your over 6 ft tall.
customer_reviews.author: Marty J.

customer_reviews.title: Has a Great Rack
customer_reviews.text: I have a short ceiling in the basement and this was the perfect solution. Easy assembly, it recommends two but i was able to complete alone. Great product and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and good size for me and my son as ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly in a low ceiling basement under 82 inches. Very sturdy and good size for me and my son as we are both 5'8". Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a rack that has a low ceiling. Definitely recommend setting up by two people which took about 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly and in good shape. Easy to assemble. Seems sturdy. Looking forward to many years of service.
customer_reviews.author: Lazza C

customer_reviews.title: Works great, fits great
customer_reviews.text: Works great, fits great. It was pretty easy to put together, though you probably want a socket wrench to do it quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Ditson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for the money. Very stabke rack great for my home gym
customer_reviews.author: Matthew&CheyenneMostlyCheyenne

customer_reviews.title: Missing hardware but soild product
customer_reviews.text: Was missing washers and had the incorrect amount of hex bolts, had to purchase additional hardware. Otherwise solid product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too Short
customer_reviews.text: This is for kids not adults. You hit your head on the top bars. Buy a taller one.
customer_reviews.author: lyle grimm

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly. Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping. Easy assembly. Sturdy. Just what I needed for basement with low ceiling
customer_reviews.author: kmp683

customer_reviews.title: Happy as can be
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with the product. It was shipped and recieved in full when promised. It was very easy to assemble. It's very well built and it's perfect for low ceiling's. I give the product 5 stars, I normally don't write reviews but this product deserves the credit. If you can jack some steal this can hold any weight you load on it.
customer_reviews.author: marcusfuentes

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It did not come with assembly instructions, which proved frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: mena

customer_reviews.title: Great rack for small spaces
customer_reviews.text: We live in a rowhome in the city, so the basement ceilings are pretty low. I'm 5'3'' and I can make a fist and touch the ceiling, so I was worried about the height of this, but really wanted to be able to lift heavy at home. This rack is sturdy, we don't have any sandbags on it yet and we've been using it with no issues. It was also relatively easy to put together, but I'd recommend a good ratchet wrench. Very happy with this!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Titan Power Rack
customer_reviews.text: Completely satisfied with product. Shipped to my home in express fashion despite weight of equipment. Well constructed with easy assembly. Can pull-up bar or rear cross-bar be removed without affecting operational intergrety of equipment? It may assist taller equipment users.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Gayle

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to put together. The height is great to fit in almost any basement.
customer_reviews.author: Jipomax!

customer_reviews.title: This fits perfect. There is another style on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: The drop ceiling in my gameroom is 76". This fits perfect. There is another style on Amazon, but the front chin bar seemed to add strength to this item and was better placed than the rear of the cage which is against the wall in my house. It also weighs more than the other style which gave me the impression that it is more sturdy. The item was quickly shipped, packaged well, and was easy to build. After working out a couple times since it arrived, I am very satisfied. The security is there to workout by myself and not have to worry about crawling out from under a failed bench press or especially a squat.
customer_reviews.author: W88s

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Easy to build... works great. Sturdy. No problems whatsoever. Great Product!
customer_reviews.author: JKDJose

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Product came quick and easy to put together by my self in 30 minutes excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Solid piece of equipment, perfect for low ceilings. The chin up bar is sort of useless even for a short guy like me. FedEx beat the hell out of the box, but it was well packed and nothing was damaged inside.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Fits in my low ceiling basement. No complaints thus far (5 months).
customer_reviews.author: Bram Rusk

customer_reviews.title: I too am short...
customer_reviews.text: Before buying this, measure 71.5" and make sure you can stand comfortably under that. I personally was a little worried I was gonna be hitting my head every time I stood up. I did some adjustments and It works fine now!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Corona

customer_reviews.title: ... combo wrench 2 f them and you be just fine.
customer_reviews.text: I install it myself and the hardest part was tighten the Nuys and bolts you will need to purchase an 18mm combo wrench 2 f them and you be just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Armando Roman

customer_reviews.title: Had for for over a year still getting my workouts ...
customer_reviews.text: Had for for over a year still getting my workouts done well and helps me practice chin ups pulls ups in my own private space
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Rack works and does what it is supposed to do and is quite sturdy. even w/o weights on the rear pegs to ...
customer_reviews.text: Standing @ 5'10" I knew that the rack was going to be on the short side but I couldn't fit a 'full' sized rack in the basement. Rack works and does what it is supposed to do and is quite sturdy. even w/o weights on the rear pegs to stabilize it has handled 280lbs well and without shifting during re-racking. My only 'complaint' is that the knurling looks like its for show and is quite smooth. Knurling seems to have been painted over and consequently filled in but it wasn't anything that a little athletic tape couldn't fix. =)
customer_reviews.author: J. Fad

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble... And i can do a lot of exercises now. Its just one of the support bar is kinda' bent so it's so hard to to put in. And the J-hooks is kinda bent too, so i just hammered it down to kinda' open it a little bit. But other than that, it's a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: allyson narzoles

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and fits perfectly in my low basement. Solid construction and great features for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Seery

customer_reviews.title: Great cage
customer_reviews.text: Solid, handles heavy weight well. Only complaint is its a little short. Nothing a little home engineering couldn't fix.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Aadland

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This rack was just what my son needed - thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Penny Gohring

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! Very sturdy, shipping was quick and customer service was one of the best I've come across with so far!
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTOPHER

customer_reviews.title: Nice and solid though the welds look messy
customer_reviews.text: Nice and solid though the welds look messy. The knurled pull up bar is virtually unknurled by the thick paint - perhaps it will wear off over time? Nice to have an impact wrench to put this together - took maybe 20 minutes. Be careful though: you can pinch the metal at the top of the uprights which prevents putting on the plastic end caps. Oops - oh well, whatever...
customer_reviews.author: El Stevo

customer_reviews.title: Great Rack!!! Great Price!!!
customer_reviews.text: Like the description said... it is a short rack. I do have to duck my head while entering it. I'm 5'-10". Took about an hour by myself to assemble. It was very sturdy. Dip Bars fit great and we're properly aligned. Great addition to my home gym. Remember, unless you mounted it to the floor, it will rock or slide if you just slam the weight bar back onto it.
customer_reviews.author: J23S

customer_reviews.title: Great for bench also
customer_reviews.text: I love it. The 81 inch squat rack would be better for pull ups. I'm too tall for the one I bought at 70 inches. Other than that great rack for the money. I've already lost 5 lbs and got stronger on the bench.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Espinal

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and easy to assemble. Nice height for my short basement.
customer_reviews.author: E. Livingston

product_meta.title: TITAN FITNESS Short Power Rack T-2 Series Weightlifting Equipment
feature_bullets: STURDY STEEL CONSTRUCTION: Our power rack is a fantastic investment for both serious athletes and beginners alike. It is made from heavy-duty steel for durability. Its all-steel structure ensures that it will hold up for years without damage. The powerful steel frame is also strong enough to hold a capacity of up to 700 lbs.

BUILD STRONG MUSCLES: This short Titan Power Rack is a must-have. This piece of equipment can fit in small basements that wont accommodate standard power racks. You can perform a variety of exercises with this rack, including chin-ups, dips, curls, deadlifts, and squats. If you want to do bench presses, place a bench underneath and youre good to go. In no time, youll be looking fit and trim.

DIMENSIONS: This durable steel power rack weighs about 123 lbs. It has a total height of 71.5in, has a 44-inch opening, and has a depth of 24 in. It takes up 48in x 58in of the floor. The steel tubes are 2in x 2in. The pull-up bar is 68.5in off the ground. This compact rack is will fit in your home gym, basement, or garage. Add this amazing rack to your collection today.

QUICK and EASY ASSEMBLY: Dont waste time with excess hardware and complicated construction. Setting up your power rack with all your workout gear and accessories is simple. This set comes with all necessary hardware, including J-hooks. With Titan products, youll spend less time assembling your new equipment and more time using it.
